===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かい|しょう}}
{{IPAchar|/kaiseu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaiɕeu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaiɕoː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かいしょう}} compound {{m|zh|海嘯|tr=xoj<sup>X</sup> sew<sup>H</sup>|lit=sea, ocean + to roar, to wail}}, with the latter character in reference to the sound of the rushing water during a [[tidal bore]].  Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''hǎixiào''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|かいしょう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいしょう|hhira=かいせう}}

# a [[tidal bore]]
# a [[tsunami]], a [[tidal wave]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=つなみ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=つなみ|津|tr1=tsu|t1=cove, inlet, outlet|波|tr2=nami|t2=wave}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

The spelling is {{ateji|sort=つなみ}}, probably as the result of applying the spelling for the Chinese-derived term ''kaishō'' to the native Japanese term ''tsunami'', given the superficial similarity of a [[tidal bore]] to a [[tsunami]].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|つなみ|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|津波}}, {{ja-l|津浪}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つなみ}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|津波}}: {{lb|ja|hydrology|less common|sort=つなみ}} a [[tidal bore]]
# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|津波}}: {{lb|ja|oceanography|sort=つなみ}} a [[tsunami]], a [[tidal wave]]
